intro: Jacquinotia volubilis, commonly known as the creeping jacquinotia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Jacquinotia volubilis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
